definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll
to curl up/to lie with knees drawn up/to huddle up
to curl up/to lie curled up
entering the Way, you seem to coil back (Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3], the Book of Dao 道德经, Chap. 14)/progress in the Dao can seem illusory

sentences.english: The two girls have fallen asleep in a little heap.
sentences.chinese: 两个女孩都蜷着身子睡熟了。

sentences.english: He lay huddled up in bed.
sentences.chinese: 他躺在床上，蜷缩成一团。

sentences.english: If you sleep curled up, you are probably a very nervous person.
sentences.chinese: 如果你缩蜷身体而睡，则你很可能是个易紧张之人。

sentences.english: Seeing her beloved owner leave, she also feels gloomy, neglect others, and huddle up in a corner, unanimated.
sentences.chinese: 学会了冷落人，她蜷在小角落里，无精打采的。

sentences.english: The children cuddled up under the warm blankets.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们蜷着身子睡在温暖的毯子里。

sentences.english: We crouched on the sofa, shooting the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 我们蜷在沙发里谈天说地。

sentences.english: While sleeping, try lying in a curled-up, fetal position with a pillow between your legs.
sentences.chinese: 睡觉时，试着蜷着腿并在腿间夹一个枕头。

sentences.english: Pressing down the alarm-clock, he curled up for a last warm minute.
sentences.chinese: 按下闹钟，他蜷在暖和的被窝里再赖一会。

sentences.english: He turned his baleful glare on the cowering suspect.
sentences.chinese: 他歹毒地盯着那个蜷缩成一团的嫌疑犯。

sentences.english: A hedgehog rolls itself into a ball when attacked.
sentences.chinese: 刺猬一受到攻击就蜷缩成一团。

sentences.english: She just curls up and sucks peppermints.
sentences.chinese: 她老是蜷着腿躺着，吮着薄荷糖。

sentences.english: The dog curled itself up on the rug.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗蜷着身子躺在地毯上。

sentences.english: Why not rent it out, curl up on the sofa and enjoy the company?
sentences.chinese: 何不租下它一张碟，两个人一起蜷在沙发上看呢？

sentences.english: The two young women fall asleep in a little heap.
sentences.chinese: 两个女孩都蜷着身子睡熟了。

sentences.english: We find Red slouched in a folding chair, watching the movie.
sentences.chinese: 瑞德则懒懒地蜷在折椅上，看着电影。

sentences.english: Mandy rolled her shoulders, sank into that honeyed post-class ache.
sentences.chinese: 曼迪蜷着肩膀曼迪蜷着身子，陷入甜蜜的课后疼痛。

definition: to curl up/to lie with knees drawn up/to huddle up
to curl up shivering (from cold)/timid and trembling (in fear)/to shrink/to cower
to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
to curl up/to lie curled up
